intro: Scilla gorganensis, commonly known as the Gorgona scilla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It blooms in early spring, adding a striking visual element to its natural habitat. Scilla gorganensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
